text:
Hi all, I have a random question, when we first got started with HubSpot we uploaded a lot of images into the main folder.

Now that we are in the process of building our site in it, we would like to move these images into a sub-folder. My question is if I do this via the FTP, will redirects be created? If not, is there a fast way to create such redirects?

Thanks!
Cause I didn't want to waste too much time, I decided to do it manually. Without using the FTP. seems to have worked fine that way.

When i try to rename a CTA in a specific portal, the dialog just disappears while typing the name. This is really annoying. Thankfully it only happens in  Chrome. Has anyone else seen this bug as well?
We are working on a way to include these assets in subfolders right now
Yes! This happens all the time when I'm cloning and renaming CTAs
so <@U6GNQ7JBU> just wrote me " It may be a cookie permissions issue, have you tried logging out and back in to reset the cookies?"
Any Lazy Loading experts in here?  Looking for some easy wins in increasing my performance ratings from page speed insights and I'm wondering if that's the way to go
cant hurt :slightly_smiling_face:
if you have majority chrome users it's also super easy now. just add `loading="lazy"` to your images/iframes
Oh wow.  Thanks <@U7V9DQ31P> .  Unfortunately, the bulk of the images on my site are background-image, but I'm going to try this for the rest
there is a script out there for bg images.
lemme see if i can find it
`<http://jquery.eisbehr.de/lazy/example_load-background-images>`
but you will need to add a data-src attribute to the div with the bg image.
AHHHH... ok, I'm finally understanding this
I had somehow thought that the img url that went in data-src was a low rez placeholder

Anyone having any issues accessing certain HubSpot sites today? A team member is trying to figure out if there's something wrong with his internet or if there may be a system issue; the "IP address not found" errors are only happening on HS sites
Do you have a screenshot of the error?
Shooting you a DM

Does anyone know if you can see what IP address a lead came from when they submitted a form(s) on the site? We have a client who believes an ex-employee may be messing with them and they want to track a specific lead down.
I've looked at the Contact and Form Submission APIs and those don't appear to return an IP address either
I don't think you can actually see the full IP address.  Closest you can get to that would be IP city, IP country code, IP state/region code, IP country, IP state/region, IP time zone properties

Thanks. I'll see if that'll suffice for the client. Any chance you know how it handles multiple IPs? Lets say this lead used 2 or 3 different computers over a month, does HS just store the first or last, or is there a way to tell the IP is changing over time?
